page.title: 17PAST RECREATION
page.content: On{Mayday}(see p.8 FOLK CUSTOMS IN ILMINGTON),just after the First World War the children of the village were gathered at school to choose a boy and a girl who were given the titles of {May King}and{May Queen}of Ilmington. Then they danced around the{Maypole} and sang songs. As there were few vehicles the children used to play games in the{ {streets}.Their games were hoops, hopscotch, marbles and rounders (using the hand to hit the ball with). Once a year the{June Club}had a fair with ginny horses by the Howard Arms and swinging boats by the Red Lion.In October of each year a{pigroast}was held by the Red Lion and a fete was held in Middle Meadow grounds.Of all these events and activities only{May {Day}is still celebrated.
